description._content: Description: R Courantyne. Boat Kutari (dot near top of photo) passing schooner. Taken from plane shows size of river about 40 miles from mouth. Location: Guyana Date: 1935-1937 Description: Boats in R. Courantyne above Hepsiba depot. Right hand bend is within 40 mins. walk of river beyond edge of photo. Boats take a whole day to reach that point. Location: Hepsiba, Guyana Date: 1935-1937 Description: Hepsiba. Unloading Schooner Blossom before jetty was built. Very slow work. Location: Hepsiba, Guyana Date: 1935-1937 Description: Hepsiba. Commission boats being loaded for next 100 miles section up river to Wonotobo Depot. Location: Hepsiba, Guyana Date: 1935-1937 Description: Wonotobo Depot. Hauling boat over portage (3.5 miles up and down hill). Location: Wonotobo, Guyana Date: 1935-1937 Description: Williams sea plane on ramp at Wonotobo. Location: Wonotobo, Guyana Date: 1935-1937 Our Catalogue Reference: Part of CO 1069/365 This image is part of the Colonial Office photographic collection held at The National Archives, uploaded as part of the Caribbean Through a Lens project. We have attempted to provide place information for the images automatically but our software may not have found the correct location. We need your help to fill in the gaps, to unearth the missing stories, the social and cultural memories from this selection of colonial recordings. Do you recognise anything or anyone in the photographs? Do they provoke any personal or historical memories? If so, please leave your comments, tags and stories to enrich our records. If you would like to get involved in our community project Caribbean through a lens, we would love to hear from you. For high quality reproductions of any item from our collection please contact our image library
